trait.name: Relentless 3/Long Rest
entries: If the Eldritch (Kaladir) takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multi-Attack
entries: The Eldritch (Kaladir) makes two Imaginary Greataxe Attacks.

action.name: Imaginary Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 8}) psychic damage.

action.name: The Quickening
entries: The Eldritch (Kaladir) can choose to mark one creature for death, for 1 minute. When it takes the Attack action on its turn, if it hits only that creature, it can make one more weapon attack than it normally could.

action.name: Mutual Understanding
entries: The Eldritch (Kaladir) can choose one creature it can see. That creature must make a {@dc 10} Sanity Check or lose one point of sanity.

trait.name: Clumsy Flying
entries: When the Garden of Eyes ends its turn in flight, it falls. If the Garden of Eyes is able to use its wings while falling it only takes half a5 much falling damage.
Alien Mind, The Garden of Eyes has advantage on all
Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against spells.

trait.name: Charge
entries: \fthe Garden of Fyes flıes At least 10 ft. straight teward a creature and then successfully grapples it on the same turn, the Garden of Eyes canı make a Frenzied Assault attack against the {@condition grappled} creature a5 a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Garden of Eyes makes 2 claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attock: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 (1di6+3) sSlashing damage.

action.name: Frenzied Assault
entries: The Garden of Eyes assaults a {@condition grappled} creature's body and mind. The creature has a5 to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw, on a failed save it becomes {@condition frightened} until the end of the creature's next turn, on a successful save the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and is not {@condition frightened}. Ifthe creature is still {@condition frightened} at the end ofits next turn, it must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage, or half a5 much on a successful one.

trait.name: Spreading Madness
entries: A creature that has its Wisdom score reduced to 0 by a Mad One succumbs to madness and must use its actions before moving on each of its turns to make a melee attack against a creature other than itself. If no target is within reach the target must move to the closest visible creature and attack it. If the mad creature sees no other creature it is {@condition stunned} until its Wisdom score is no longer 0.

action.name: Sickle
entries: Melee Weapon Attack {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.

Art: 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 (146) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or has its Wisdom score reduced by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Amygdala fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The Amygdala's long jump is up to 40 ft. and its high jump is up to 60 ft., with or without a running start.

trait.name: Great One
entries: The Amygdalas natural weapons are magical. Additionaly it has advantage on Wisdom saving throws against magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Amygdala can use its Maddening

action.name: Presence
entries: It then makes three attacks; 2 Claw attacks and 1 Eldritch Smash attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: Melee Weapon Attack {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft, one target. Hit 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft, one target. Ait 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: Melee Weapon Attockc {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft, one creature. Hit 13 (206+6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eye Laser (Recharges 5-6)
entries: Amygdala fires a ray of eldritch energy in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide within 120 ft. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (1208) force damage on a failed and half as much on a successful ore.

action.name: Maddening Presence
entries: Each creature of the Amygdala’s
choice that is within 120 feet of the Amygdala and aware
of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or
become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature repeats the
saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the
effect on itself on a success, and taking 5 ({@dice 2d4}) psychic
damage on a failure. If a creature's saving throw is
successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is
immune to the Amygdala’s Maddening Presence for the
next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Stomp
entries: Amyodala makes a Stomp attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Amygdala moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Maddening Presence
entries: The Amyodala uses its Maddening Presence.

legendary.name: Amygdala Leap (2 Actions)
entries: The Amygdala leaps up into the air and lands in a place within 40 ft of it. Each creature within 5 ft. of it as it lands must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure a creature takes 15 (208+6) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Acidic Discharge (3 Actions) (1/Short Rest)
entries: The Amygdala violently shakes its head, spreading acid in a 20 ft cube originating from it. Each creature in that area must make a OC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 20 (804) acid damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one. The zone persists for 6 seconds (one round) and is considered difficult terrain. A creature takes 20 (G4) acid damage when it enters the zone for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

speed.UNPARSED_SPEED: 60 ft., fly 60 ft.(can only move whilst unseen)

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Petrifying Red Light Green Light
entries: While a creature observes the angel without blinking, it gains the {@condition petrified} condition and cannot move or attack. While in this state its resistances become immunities and gains all the effects of a {@condition petrified} creature. A creature can use his or her reaction to cast out a 60 ft cone with his/her sight and any angel caught in the cone will be {@condition petrified} on its next turn. After 5 uses of this ability, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 to succeed on each subsequent turn. This DC increases by 5 each time it is attempted up to a maximum of 20. The area of this ability is halved if the creature is in low light (without darkvision) and cannot be used by a {@condition blinded} creature, creatures relying on blindsight to see, those in complete darkness, undead or constructs. While not {@condition petrified} and working with other Angels, the Angel can use its reaction to ensure that it doesn't look at another Angel and If two angels fail to use their reaction and look at each other then they remain {@condition petrified} until something breaks the line of sight such as a Darkness spell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Angel has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the Angel remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Angel makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or can use its aging touch instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Aging Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) necrotic damage and the Angel regains hit points equal to the damage done. The targets maximum hit points are lowered based on the necrotic damage done and the character ages a number of years equal to the damage of the attack. The lost hit points are restored after a long rest but the additional years of age can only be restored by a greater restoration spell or similar magic. Each time a character suffers a aging touch that takes them above a venerable age (e.g. 70 with humans) they gain a level of {@condition exhaustion} and after gaining 5 levels the victim dies and turns to ash.

speed.UNPARSED_SPEED: 60 ft., fly 60 ft.(can only move whilst unseen)

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Petrifying Red Light Green Light
entries: While a creature observes the angel without blinking, it gains the {@condition petrified} condition and cannot move or attack. While in this state its resistances become immunities and gains all the effects of a {@condition petrified} creature. A creature can use his or her reaction to cast out a 60 ft cone with his/her sight and any angel caught in the cone will be {@condition petrified} on its next turn. After 5 uses of this ability, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 to succeed on each subsequent turn. This DC increases by 5 each time it is attempted up to a maximum of 20. The area of this ability is halved if the creature is in low light (without darkvision) and cannot be used by a {@condition blinded} creature, creatures relying on blindsight to see, those in complete darkness, undead or constructs. While not {@condition petrified} and working with other Angels, the Angel can use its reaction to ensure that it doesn't look at another Angel and If two angels fail to use their reaction and look at each other then they remain {@condition petrified} until something breaks the line of sight such as a Darkness spell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Angel has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the Angel remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Aging Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6({@damage 1d6 + 3}) necrotic damage and the Angel regains hit points equal to the damage done. The targets maximum hit points are lowered based on the necrotic damage done and the character ages a number of years equal to the damage of the attack. The lost hit points are restored after a long rest but the additional years of age can only be restored by a greater restoration spell or similar magic. Each time a character suffers a aging touch that takes them above a venerable age (e.g. 70 with humans) they gain a level of {@condition exhaustion} and after gaining 5 levels the victim dies and turns to ash.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Witcher can make two longsword attacks, or one Longsword and one Sign/crossbow attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@hit 5} to hit, 5 ft range. {@damage 1d8 + 3} slashing damage ({@dice 1d10 + 3} with both hands)

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: Light, loading, ranged. 30/120. {@damage 1d6 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Blade Oil
entries: The Witcher can use an action to coat his blade in an oil effective against one opponent and those of its kind, transforming it into a magical weapon that nullifies any of that creature's natural resistances to his sword.
Lasts for 10 minutes. Can be used three times, then requires a short rest to recharge.

action.name: Signs
entries: The Witcher can cast one of five simple spells.

action.name: Aard
entries: Makes a ranged Shove attack in a 15 foot cone. +5 to attack.

action.name: Igni
entries: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. {@hit 5} to hit. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Yrden
entries: Makes a ranged Grapple attack. +5 to attack, range 10 ft. On a success, the target Is {@condition restrained} until the start of the Witcher's next turn, though it can make a contested Strength saving throw to break free, and incorporeal targets are made corporeal.

action.name: Quen
entries: Reduces damage of the next attack taken by {@dice 1d4 + 2}.

action.name: Axii
entries: Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute. For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at one creature of your choice that isn't hostile toward you. When the spell ends, the creature realizes that you used magic to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A creature {@condition prone} to violence might attack you. Another creature might seek retribution in other ways (at the DM's discretion), depending on the nature of your interaction with it.

action.name: Drink Potion
entries: As an action the Witcher can drink one of the following potions. The Witcher must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 10 + the number of potions drank since the last short rest or be {@condition poisoned} for one minute.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The Witcher regenerates 5 HP at the start of its turn for two minutes.

action.name: Wolf
entries: Critical hits on 19 & 20 for one minute.

action.name: Black Blood
entries: Monsters that drink the Witcher's blood must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure they take {@damage 4d6} poison damage. On a success the damage is reduced by half. Lasts for two hours.

action.name: Blizzard
entries: Allows the Witcher to take the Dodge action as a bonus action for one minute.

action.name: Petri's Philter
entries: Add +2 to attack rolls and ability checks made from casting Signs for one minute.
Thunderbolt: For one minute, the Witcher adds {@dice 2d4} to its damage rolls, but enemies attacking him do so with advantage.

action.name: Cat
entries: Grants advantage on perception checks for 1 minute.

legendary.name: Adaptive Fighter
entries: The Witcher can make a Weapon Attack or drink a potion.

legendary.name: Footwork
entries: The Witcher can move up to half of it's speed. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Innocent Heart
entries: Walter's infant corpse lies at the heart of the Flesh Mound, crying and afraid. So long as a creature remains engulfed within the Flesh Mound, they are entrapped within the central cavity where Walter's corpse dwells.
This \"Heart\" is encased by a thick shell of white bone and pulsating veins that extend throughout the mound.
The Heart has an AC of 10 and 5 HP; if the Heart's hit points are reduced to 0, the Flesh Mound is reduced to
0 hit points and dissolves into a pile of liquid gore.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft, one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the Flesh Mound can grapple it (escape {@dc 14}) instead of dealing the bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft, one target. {@h}The Flesh Mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition restrained}, and must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns, taking 3 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage on a failure. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Languages—
entries: Challenge 1 (200 XP)

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The hound magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the hound wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

trait.name: Languages—
entries: Challenge 1/8 (25 XP)

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Unwavering Loyalty
entries: The dog will always follow the commands of an NPC that they have a positive relationship with (i.e. the dog's owner).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bark
entries: The dog uses a bonus action to have a creature within 15 of it make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the dog's next turn. The targeted creature(s) must be capable of hearing in order for this condition to take effect. Creatures affected by the Unwavering Loyalty trait automatically succeed this saving throw.
